legal_basis: Section 43(3) of the Federal Courts Act
application_details: F.C. Yachts is the legal and beneficial owner of both yachts as per the contract. Splash is merely a mortgagee, not a beneficial owner. No change in ownership occurred.
decision_reasoning: Under Section 43(3) of the Federal Courts Act, an action in rem requires the ship to be beneficially owned by the person who was the owner at the time the cause of action arose.
result_of_case: The court dismissed the actions in rem and set aside the warrant of arrest since F.C. Yachts cannot arrest its own ships.
procedure_followed: Motion brought by Splash Holdings Ltd. to set aside the arrest of the first yacht. Heard before Harrington, J., in the Federal Court.
cost_awards: Costs were awarded to Splash Holdings Ltd.
